frontpagetext: In the health atlas for gynecology, we have mapped geographical variation in the use of a selection of specialist health services within gynecology in the period 2015–2017.
ingress: The fact sheets provide a brief description of the patient samples, as well as information about the population’s use of services in geographical areas (hospital referral areas). The use is measured as the number of events per 10,000 population or as the proportion of patients that receive a certain service. The fact sheets also include brief comments on the variation in use between geographical areas.

innhold.tekst:
### Diagnosis and assessment

- [Postmenopausal bleeding](/helseatlas/files/gyneng_postmenbleeding.pdf)
- [Endometrial diagnosis](/helseatlas/files/gyneng_endodiag.pdf)
- [Colposcopy and cervical biopsy](/helseatlas/files/gyneng_colposcopy.pdf)

### Reproductive health

- [Sterilisation](/helseatlas/files/gyneng_sterilisation.pdf)
- [Surgery in connection with spontaneous abortions and abortions on request](/helseatlas/files/gyneng_abortions.pdf)
- [In vitro fertilisation](/helseatlas/files/gyneng_ivf.pdf)

### Surgical treatment of gynaecological conditions

- [Endometriosis](/helseatlas/files/gyneng_endometriosis.pdf)
- [Uterine fibroids (myomas)](/helseatlas/files/gyneng_myomas.pdf)
- [Excessive and/or frequent menstruation](/helseatlas/files/gyneng_menstruation.pdf)
- [Hysterectomy and transcervical procedures](/helseatlas/files/gyneng_hysterectomy.pdf)

### Surgical treatment of prolapse and incontinence

- [Pelvic organ prolapse](/helseatlas/files/gyneng_prolapse.pdf)
- [Urinary incontinence](/helseatlas/files/gyneng_incontinence.pdf)

**Read more:** more results and analyzes can be found in the [report](/helseatlas/files/healthatlas-gynaecology.pdf).
